ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of the field Analysis of meter Repertoire
Learned a lot about meter (as expected), but also about writing style, presentations, and a bit about teaching.
Gained many analytical tools for analyzing music from a meter perspective. Read a broad variety of pertinent literature.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I feel as if I finished the course with a good grasp on the field of metric analysis and many questions that have yet to be answered in the field.

The course was very organized and had a nice diversity of subtopics/repertoires within the topic of meter. There were some occasions (maybe two) when the pace was a bit slow; Rick would be explaining a topic to ensure everyone was following, and when asked about the pace, none of us wanted to make anyone else feel uncomfortable, so we said it was fine. I think this happened when discussing the Rahn & Pressing, and maybe one other time... Not sure how everyone else felt, and we definitely could/should have spoken up about it, but just wanted to let you know. Also loved the feedback! Was a bit harsher than I anticipated, but it definitely helped me to know what was strong about my writing and presentations, and what could be improved. And if something was acknowledged as being improved, I knew that it was a genuine remark. Glad to have gotten such feedback early on, so I can think about it as I look forward to conference presentations and article submissions.
This course was very engaging and fun. The short exercises and presentations were effective way of learning and applying the new material.

I have only positive comments. The course is well structured, the readings are dense but reasonable, discussions were open and friendly. Your comments on papers were very helpful. I really like the system of doing student seminars at the end, and I like that the workload is spread out over the course. I found the course extremely useful in learning to analyze meter, and in generally developing the ability to think like a theorist. I appreciated your flexibility with our differing approaches and skill sets.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Great course, that has positively benefited through its many iterations over the years. Would highly recommend, especially to any theorists (there was a reason we all took it, haha).
